definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
struggle session

sentences.english: One part of critical thinking is distinguishing between facts and opinions.
sentences.chinese: 批鬥性思考的一部分就是區分事實和觀點。

sentences.english: Seem to be, a bitter fight begins.
sentences.chinese: 似乎，一場狠狠的批鬥就要開始了。

sentences.english: Red Guards swarmed there for ritual denunciations of Liu and his ilk.
sentences.chinese: 無數紅衛兵在這裏給劉及其同類人開批鬥大會。

sentences.english: But according to South Korean media, the players got off lightly.
sentences.chinese: 但據韓國媒體稱，球員們還是很輕鬆地走出批鬥會的。

sentences.english: If you didn't follow the Red Guards maybe one day they would criticize you.
sentences.chinese: 如果不追隨紅衛兵的話，或許有一天他們回來批鬥你。

sentences.english: Because his grandfather was a landlord, he had been denounced.
sentences.chinese: 因爲祖父曾是地主，他受到了批鬥。

definition: frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to sneer at sb/to ridicule
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
misconception/fallacy
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
ruler/those in power/the authorities
to bully/to push around
to denounce/to condemn
reaction/reactionary
to attack (verbally or in writing)
capitalist
the capitalist class/the bourgeoisie
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to be reluctant to give up a post
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
